_chemical.ChemicalName: Hydrogen fluoride/Hydrofluoric acid (conc 50% or greater) [Hydrofluoric acid]

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Avantor Inc;, a Fortune 500 company, is a leading global provider of mission-critical products and services to customers in the biopharma, healthcare, education & government, and advanced technologies & applied materials industries. Our portfolio is used in virtually every stage of the most important research, development and production activities in the industries we serve. One of our greatest strengths comes from having a global infrastructure that is strategically located to support the needs of our customers. Our global footprint enables us to serve more than 225,000 customer locations and gives us extensive access to research laboratories and scientists in more than 180 countries. We set science in motion to create a better world.



Avantor operates the VWR International facilities located in the United States. Management is not only committed to offering superior supplies and services, but also to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. VWR International's safety and environmental policies are administered by the Service Center Manager with the assistance from the EHS3 Manager and corporate Senior Chemical Specialist, who all conduct periodic inspections of the facility to ensure compliance, and will oversee the entire safety and environmental programs, including the RMP Program.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The VWR facility is located at 12350 Southwest Tualatin Road #B, in Tualatin, Oregon. The facility is approximately 0.16 miles southeast of State Highway 99. The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban with a mixture of commercial, industrial, and residential areas. The primary business of VWR International is a chemical storage/distribution facility. All materials are in solutions of less than 50% with water. The chemicals are stored in DOT approved containers used for s

hipping by the manufacturer. The containers are delivered by freight companies. The containers remain onsite until they are purchased by a customer, at which point they are picked up for delivery to the client.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION

STEPS



In order to operate the storage and distribution facility, VWR International complies with the EPA Risk Management Program. In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed. The facility is also ISO 9001 certified.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



The facility has not had any accidents or releases or regulated substances from covered processes over the past five years (March 2016 - March 2021) that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantities for hazardous chemicals. In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from a release of a regulated substance.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The Hazard Review Revalidation, performed on March 25, 2021, generated mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the VWR International facility located in Tualatin, Oregon. The mitigation measures include additional training, key maintenance-related tests/inspections, enhanced emergency response policies and procedures. The VWR International safety committee is planning to complete several items, including the recommendations, over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees. These changes include the following items:



- Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety/Plan Programs.

- Continue to have employee involvement in Safety/Plan development.

- Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.

- Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.

- Recommendation tracking for the technical studies is maintained by the EHS3 Manager.
